item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
https://remapradio.com/articles/this-week-at-remap-59/

I have upsetting news. Some months back, I had electrical work done on my office to install ceiling lights. In trying to figure out a problem with the grounding of an outlet, we reset some breakers around the house to diagnose the issue. In doing so, my tiny Costco hot tub was turned off. It does not have a fancy app to tell me it turned off, and so, instead, it just slowly got colder and colder, until the heating pump broke, and simply beeped instead of working. It is now a brick of ice on my patio, waiting for the spring to unthaw it, so I can throw it out. RIP.

-pk, who is too sad to consider buying another one

  • PODCAST: Remap Hotline – Welcome to the first Remap Hotline of 2025! Rob, Patrick, and Cado are here to answer YOUR questions, even as the infrastructure of the US Government is crumbling around us.
  • STREAM: Steam Next Fest – One of our favorite events of the year, as we dig through a mountain of game demos in a lightning round format.
  • STREAM: The Wheel of GeForce NOW – In a delightful coincidence, it turns out Civilization VII is on GeForce NOW. The empire building shall continue.
  • ARTICLE: Remap Recommends – Another chance to let you know what we've been playing, the games that have slipped through the cracks of the podcast.
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – We'll be able to talk about Monster Hunter, my further (very fun) adventures in Avowed, and plenty more, I'm sure.
  • ARTICLE: Letter Series – So, it turns out I like ketchup on a hot dog. But I'm also just not much of a hot dog person. Love a good sausage, though. Curious.

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
